oracle.pg.text.solr

Class SolrIndex<T extends Element>

  • java.lang.Object
    • oracle.pg.text.solr.SolrIndex<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Index<T>, OracleIndex<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SolrAutoIndex, SolrEdgeIndex, SolrVertexIndex

    public abstract class SolrIndex<T extends Element>
extends Object
implements OracleIndex<T>
    An abstract class implementing the Blueprints Index interface to support indices on SolrCloud.

      • appendDatatypesSuffixToKey

        public String appendDatatypesSuffixToKey(String key,
                                Class dtValue)
        This operation will append the data type suffix to the key based on the LuceneIndex configuration. The data type suffix is required in order to retrieve matches when executing a text search query over a Key/Value pair.
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the K/V property
        dtValue - the data type of the value object
        Returns:
        a Lucene syntax String representation of the key with respect to the given datatype

      • appendDatatypesSuffixToValue

        public String appendDatatypesSuffixToValue(Object value,
                                  Class dtValue)
        This operation will append the data type suffix to the String representation of the given value based on the LuceneIndex configuration. The data type suffix is required in order to retrieve matches when executing a text search query over a Key/Value pair.
        Parameters:
        value - the value of the K/V property
        dtValue - the data type of the value object
        Returns:
        a Lucene syntax String representation of the value with respect to the given datatype

      • buildSearchTerm

        public String buildSearchTerm(String key,
                     Object value,
                     Class dtClass)
        Builds a search term query expression in the syntax required by this index.
        Specified by:
        buildSearchTerm in interface OracleIndex<T extends Element>
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the K/V property
        value - the value object of the K/V property
        dtClass - the class representing the datatype of the property value. This can be used to cast the property value to a different datatype. For example, if the value is "3.01" and dtClass is Float.Class, then this value will be treated as a 3.01f.

      • count

        public long count(String key,
         Object value,
         Class dtClass,
         boolean acceptWildcard)

        key - the key of the K/V property
        value - the value object of the K/V property

        Returns:
        a positive long integer representing the number of elements matching the K/V property.

      • getPartitioned

        public abstract CloseableIterable<T>[] getPartitioned(Object[] connections,
                                    Object query,
                                    int startShardId)
        Gets an array of CloseableIterable objects that hold all the elements with an attribute matching the given K/V pair. This object can be either a String text search query, a SolrQuery object or a QueryResponse from SolrCloud. Each element in the CloseableIterable array uses a separate connection provided to fetch a subset of the results from a corresponding SolrCloud shard. Note that we assign an integer ID (in the range of [0, N - 1]) to all the shards in a SolrCloud cluster with N shards. The subset of shards queried will consist of those shards with ID value in the range of [startShardId, startShardId - 1 + size of connections array].
        Specified by:
        getPartitioned in interface OracleIndex<T extends Element>
        Parameters:
        connections - an array of connections to the SolrCloud. Each element of this array should be of type CloudSolrServer. See getCloudSolrServer(long).
        startShardId - the ID of the starting shard.
        query - the query object.
        Returns:
        a CloseableIterable object.

      • getPartitioned

        public final CloseableIterable<T>[] getPartitioned(Object[] connections,
                                    String key,
                                    Object value,
                                    boolean acceptWildcard,
                                    int startShardId)
        Gets an array of CloseableIterable objects that hold all the elements with an attribute matching the given K/V pair. Each element in the CloseableIterable array uses a separate connection provided to fetch a subset of the results from a corresponding SolrCloud shard. Note that we assign an integer ID (in the range of [0, N - 1]) to all the shards in a SolrCloud cluster with N shards. The subset of shards queried will consist of those shards with ID value in the range of [startShardId, startShardId - 1 + size of connections array].
        Specified by:
        getPartitioned in interface OracleIndex<T extends Element>
        Parameters:
        connections - an array of connections to the SolrCloud. Each element of this array should be of type CloudSolrServer. See getCloudSolrServer(long).
        key - the key of a property
        value - the value object of the property.
        acceptWildcard - specifies if wild cards can be used in the value object.
        startShardId - the ID of the starting shard.
        Returns:
        a CloseableIterable object.

      • getPartitioned

        public abstract CloseableIterable<T>[] getPartitioned(Object[] connections,
                                    String key,
                                    Object value,
                                    Class dtClass,
                                    boolean acceptWildcard,
                                    int startShardId)
        Gets an array of CloseableIterable objects that hold all the elements with an attribute matching the given K/V pair. Each element in the CloseableIterable array uses a separate connection provided to fetch a subset of the results from a corresponding SolrCloud shard. Note that we assign an integer ID (in the range of [0, N - 1]) to all the shards in a SolrCloud cluster with N shards. The subset of shards queried will consist of those shards with ID value in the range of [startShardId, startShardId - 1 + size of connections array].
        Specified by:
        getPartitioned in interface OracleIndex<T extends Element>
        Parameters:
        connections - an array of connections to the SolrCloud. Each element of this array should be of type CloudSolrServer. See getCloudSolrServer(long).
        key - the key of a property
        value - the value object of the property.
        dtClass - the class representing the datatype of the property value. This can be used to cast the property value to a different datatype. For example, if the value is "3.01" and dtClass is Float.Class, then this value will be treated as a 3.01f.
        acceptWildcard - specifies if wild cards can be used in the value object.
        startShardId - the ID of the starting shard.
        Returns:
        a CloseableIterable object.

      • getShardsNames

        public List<String> getShardsNames()

        Parameters:
        cloudSolrServer - if not null, use the opened CloudSolrServer connection, this avoids opening/closing a CloudSolrServer connection at flush time.

      • put

        public void put(String key,
       Object value,
       T element)
        Indexes an element by a key and a value.
        Specified by:
        put in interface Index<T extends Element>
        Parameters:
        key - the key to index the element by.
        value - the value to index the element by.
        element - the element to index.

      • put

        public void put(String key,
       Object value,
       T element,
       org.apache.solr.client.solrj.impl.CloudSolrServer cloudSolrServer)
        Indexes an element by a key and a value. Using a cloudSolrServer object helps open/commit/close connections to SolrCloud. The user is responsible of executing commits the cloudSolrServer object so the changes executed by this operation are persisted into the text index.
        Parameters:
        key - the key to index the element by.
        value - the value to index the element by.
        element - the element to index.
        cloudSolrServer - if not null, use the opened CloudSolrServer connection, this avoids opening/closing a CloudSolrServer connection at flush time.

      • remove

        public void remove(String key,
          Object value,
          Class dtClass,
          T element,
          org.apache.solr.client.solrj.impl.CloudSolrServer cloudSolrServer)
        Removes an element indexed by a particular key/value. Using a cloudSolrServer object helps open/commit/close connections to SolrCloud. The user is responsible of executing commits the cloudSolrServer object so the changes executed by this operation are persisted into the text index.
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the indexed element.
        value - the value of the indexed element.
        dtClass - the data type class of the indexed element.
        element - the element to remove given the key/value pair.
        cloudSolrServer - if not null, use the opened CloudSolrServer connection, this avoids opening/closing a CloudSolrServer connection at flush time.

      • remove

          T element)
        Removes an element indexed by a particular key/value.

        Parameters:

        value - the value of the indexed element.
        element - the element to remove given the key/value pair.
